pullRequest.body:
Reduce the diff of #11203


---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8408737640/job/23025245964)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8408737640/job/23025245998)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8408737640/job/23025245916)

seems like a strange way to test for this, especially because something like that might move to `Std` at some point. (EDIT: nevermind, I see you just pulled this from the bottom of the file. Is there a reason for moving it?)

The reason is that the content of a file doesn't change whether an `assert_not_exists` in it succeeds or not, so we might as well put it as early as possible.

I believe @semorrison started by putting them at the end, but eventually decided to put them first.

```suggestion
  /-- However `Rat.cast` is defined, it must be propositionally equal to `a * bâ»Â¹`.
```

```suggestion
  /-- However `qsmul` is defined, it must be equal to propsitionally multiplication by `Rat.cast`.
```
I don't think we want to explicitly advocate for the default values.
Nono, this is not advocating for default values. This is saying that people shouldn't be writing `DivisionRing.qsmul q a` but `q â¢ a`
No, above that it says, "Set this to `qsmulRec` unless ..."
Oh, I didn't write that. @eric-wieser just added it in #11262
Not for this PR: is it possible to have an `ofScientific` instance for `ââ¥0` (or types with an `NNRatCast` instance)? I guess it would probably require interpreting `-1.2` as `1.2`.
I think that would be a big trap. Certainly if people want it they can add it, but I won't do so myself
